name: In-channel ponding or beaver dams
functionStatement: Wetlands and storage features store floodwater, recharge groundwater, sustain baseflow, and provide low-velocity habitat.
descriptionMarkdown: Small beaver-type impoundments aid baseflow/habitat; no major fragmentation unless historically normal.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Count beaver dams or ponded sections per 100 m of channel. Use recent aerial imagery to pre-screen and compare to expected capacity for the setting.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Beaver dams or small ponds enhance baseflow and habitat with negligible fragmentation.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Widespread channel fragmentation or overabundant ponding.

references: Beaver Restoration Assessment Tool (BRAT) for capacity context.
